channel.title: Arm : [Warn] guard is failing an extremely large amounts of circuits.
channel.description:
Few weeks ago my connections to other PC started to drop abruptly. I looked into ARM and see this :
*TIME* [WARN] Your Guard ---- ($****) is failing an extremely large amounts of circuits. This could indicate a route manipulation attack, extreme network overload or a bug. Success counts are ---. Use counts are ---. --- circuits completed. --- were unusable, --- collapsed and --- timed out. For reference, your timeout cutoff is 60 seconds.
your guard ---- ($----) is failing a very large amounts of circuits. Most likely this means The Tor network is overloaded, but it could also mean an attack against you or potentially the guard itself. Success counts ....
could it be attack on me ?
I am using virtualbox.

item.title: Arm : [Warn] guard is failing an extremely large amounts of circuits.
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It’s a general Tor question. Better to go through the Tor support channels, as per:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle

Read full topic
item.source: Arm : [Warn] guard is failing an extremely large amounts of circuits.
